events.event_description: U.S. natural gas exports hit a record of 20.9 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d) in 2023, a 10% increase from 2022.
events.citation: The United States exported 10% more natural gas in 2023 than in 2022, a record of 20.9 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d), according to our Natural Gas Monthly.

events.event_description: U.S. LNG exports reached a record high of 13.6 Bcf/d in December 2023.
events.citation: U.S. LNG exports averaged a record 13.6 Bcf/d in December 2023.

events.event_description: Pipeline exports from West Texas to Mexico increased by 20% to 1.6 Bcf/d compared to 2022.
events.citation: Pipeline exports to Mexico from Texas increased 9% to 5.6 Bcf/d in 2023, with most of the growth coming from exports from West Texas, which increased by 20% (1.6 Bcf/d) compared with 2022.

events.event_description: Wildfires in western Canada disrupted natural gas deliveries to the United States, causing imports to drop 9% compared to the same period in 2022.
events.citation: Wildfires in western Canada in April and May 2023 also disrupted deliveries from Canada, and imports from Canada in those months averaged 9% less than in the same period in 2022.

events.event_description: Warmer-than-average temperatures in the Northeast led to reduced LNG imports compared to 2022 due to lower demand.
events.citation: Warmer-than-average temperatures in the Northeast at the beginning and end of 2023 reduced natural gas demand, resulting in lower LNG imports compared with 2022.
